channel.title: math.RA updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.RA updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Linear super-commuting maps and super-biderivations on Hom-lie superalgebras
item.description: arXiv:2411.00810v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper investigates the fundamental connections between linear super-commuting maps, super-biderivations, and centroids in Hom-Lie superalgebras under certain conditions. Our work generalizes the results of Bresar and Zhao on Lie algebras.
item.dc:creator: Ashutosh Pandey

item.title: Graded Identities for the Adjoont Representation of $sl_2$
item.description: arXiv:2411.00811v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $K$ be a field of characteristic zero and let $\mathfrak{sl}_2 (K)$ be the 3-dimensional simple Lie algebra over $K$. In this paper we describe a finite basis for the $\mathbb{Z}_2$-graded identities of the adjoint representation of $\mathfrak{sl}_2 (K)$, or equivalently, the $\mathbb{Z}_2$-graded identities for the pair $(M_3(K), \mathfrak{sl}_2 (K))$. We work with the canonical grading on $\mathfrak{sl}_2 (K)$ and the only nontrivial $\mathbb{Z}_2$-grading of the associative algebra $M_3(K)$ induced by that on $\mathfrak{sl}_2(K)$.
item.dc:creator: C\'assia F. Sampaio, Plamen E. Koshlukov

item.title: Hochschild cohomology of the universal associative conformal envelope of the Virasoro Lie conformal algebra with coefficients in all finite modules
item.description: arXiv:2411.00812v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, we find the Hochschild cohomology groups of the universal associative conformal envelope $U(3)$ of the Virasoro Lie conformal algebra with respect to associative locality $N=3$ on the generator with coefficients in all finite modules. In order to obtain this result, we construct the Anick resolution via the algebraic discrete Morse theory and Gr\"obner--Shirshov basis.
item.dc:creator: Hassan Alhussein, Pavel Kolesnikov, Viktor Lopatkin

item.title: Tensor products of Leibniz bimodules and Grothendieck rings
item.description: arXiv:2411.01044v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper we define three different notions of tensor products for Leibniz bimodules. The ``natural" tensor product of Leibniz bimodules is not always a Leibniz bimodule. In order to fix this, we introduce the notion of a weak Leibniz bimodule and show that the ``natural" tensor product of weak bimodules is again a weak bimodule. Moreover, it turns out that weak Leibniz bimodules are modules over a cocommutative Hopf algebra canonically associated to the Leibniz algebra. Therefore, the category of all weak Leibniz bimodules is symmetric monoidal and the full subcategory of finite-dimensional weak Leibniz bimodules is rigid and pivotal. On the other hand, we introduce two truncated tensor products of Leibniz bimodules which are again Leibniz bimodules. These tensor products induce a non-associative multiplication on the Grothendieck group of the category of finite-dimensional Leibniz bimodules. In particular, we prove that in characteristic zero for a finite-dimensional solvable Leibniz algebra this Grothendieck ring is an alternative power-associative commutative Jordan ring, but for a finite-dimensional non-zero semi-simple Leibniz algebra it is neither alternative nor a Jordan ring.
item.dc:creator: J\"org Feldvoss, Friedrich Wagemann

item.title: Reverse order law for NDMPI of dual matrices and its applications
item.description: arXiv:2411.01294v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This manuscript establishes several sufficient conditions for the validity of both the reverse order law and forward order law for NDMPI. Additionally, some characterization of the reverse order law of the NDMPI is obtained. We also explore the applications of the reverse order law within this framework. Finally, we demonstrate the additivity of the NDMPI, supported by illustrative examples.
item.dc:creator: Tikesh Verma, Amit Kumar, Debasisha Mishra

item.title: Cayley Hamilton algebras and a paper by Skip Garibaldi
item.description: arXiv:2411.01320v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper we discuss the minimal Cayley Hamilton norm for a finite dimensional algebra over a field $F$ based on a paper by Skip Garibaldi
item.dc:creator: Claudio Procesi

item.title: Kupershmidt operators on $3$-BiHom-Poisson color algebras and $3$-BiHom-pre-Poisson color algebras structures
item.description: arXiv:2411.01413v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to introduce the class of noncommutative $3$-BiHom-Poisson color algebras, which is a combination of $3$-BiHom-Lie color algebras and BiHom-associative color algebras under a compatibility condition, called BiHom-Leibniz color identity, and then study their representations and associated Kupershmidt operators. In addition, we introduce the notion of noncommutative $3$-BiHom-pre-Poisson color algebras and investigate the relationship between noncommutative $3$-BiHom-Poisson color algebras and $3$-BiHom-pre-Poisson color algebras via Kupershmidt operators.
item.dc:creator: Othmen Ncib, Sergei Silvestrov

item.title: Williams' and Graded Equivalence Conjectures for small graphs
item.description: arXiv:2411.01741v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove what might have been expected: The Williams Conjecture in symbolic dynamics and Graded Morita Equivalence Conjecture for Leavitt/$C^*$-graph algebras hold for ``small graphs'', i.e., connected graphs with three vertices, no parallel edges, no sinks with no trivial hereditary and saturated subsets. Namely, two small graphs are shift equivalent if and only if they are strong shift equivalent if and only if their Leavitt/$C^*$-graph algebras are graded/equivariant Morita equivalent.
item.dc:creator: Roozbeh Hazrat, Elizabeth Pacheco

item.title: Pointed Hopf algebras of odd dimension and Nichols algebras over solvable groups
item.description: arXiv:2411.02304v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We classify finite-dimensional Nichols algebras of Yetter-Drinfeld modules with indecomposable support over finite solvable groups in characteristic 0, using a variety of methods including reduction to positive characteristic. As a consequence, all Nichols algebras over groups of odd order are of diagonal type, which allows us to describe all pointed Hopf algebras of odd dimension.
item.dc:creator: N. Andruskiewitsch, I. Heckenberger, L. Vendramin

item.title: PBW-deformations of smash products involving Hopf algebra of Kac-Paljutkin type
item.description: arXiv:2408.16557v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper, it is shown that all PBW-deformations of the smash product $A \# H_{2n^2}$ for the Kac-Paljutkin type Hopf algebra $H_{2n^2}$ that preserve the grading on its Koszul $H_{2n^2}$-module algebra $A$. A necessary and sufficient condition for the Koszul dual algebra $A^{!}$ to be an $H$-module algebra is provided. Then we describe all PBW-deformations of the smash product algebra $A^! \# H_{2n^2}$ for a given $H_{2n^2}$-module algebra $A$. Additionally, we introduce the braided tensor product algebra $(A \otimes^c A^{\mathrm{op}}_c) \# H_{2n^2}$ and explore all nontrivial PBW-deformations of this algebra.
item.dc:creator: Yujie Gao, Shilin Yang
